check let's now analyze the performance
of
checkum basically this check suum is a
very powerful technique because it can
detect all errors involving odd number
of bits as well as it can detect most
errors involving an even number of bits
so it is powerful to some extent in
detecting bit errors as well as burst
errors but the main problem is if one or
more bits of a segment are damaged and
the corresponding bit or bits of the
opposite value in the second segment are
also damaged then the sum of these
columns will not change if the sum of
the columns are not changed the receiver
will not detect the errors simply if if
the errors involving that there is no
change in the summation then the check
sum technique will not detect the errors
that's the drawback and that's it guys
